    io.gitlab.arturbosch.detekt.api - detekt-api

    Edit me

    detekt-api / io.gitlab.arturbosch.detekt.api

    Package io.gitlab.arturbosch.detekt.api

    Types

    AnnotationExcluder Primary use case for an AnnotationExcluder is to decide if a KtElement should be excluded from further analysis. This is done by checking if a special annotation is present over the element.class AnnotationExcluder
    BaseConfig Convenient base configuration which parses/casts the configuration value based on the type of the default value.typealias ~~BaseConfig~~ = BaseConfig
    BaseRule Defines the visiting mechanism for KtFile’s.typealias ~~BaseRule~~ = BaseRule
    CodeSmell A code smell indicates any possible design problem inside a program’s source code. The type of a code smell is described by an Issue.open class CodeSmell : Finding
    Compactable Provides a compact string representation.interface Compactable
    CompositeConfig Wraps two different configuration which should be considered when retrieving properties.typealias ~~CompositeConfig~~ = CompositeConfig
    Config A configuration holds information about how to configure specific rules.interface Config
    ConfigAware Interface which is implemented by each Rule class to provide utility functions to retrieve specific or generic properties from the underlying detekt configuration file.interface ConfigAware : Config
    ConfigValidator An extension which allows users to validate parts of the configuration.interface ConfigValidator : Extension
    ConsoleReport Extension point which describes how findings should be printed on the console.abstract class ConsoleReport : Extension
    Context A context describes the storing and reporting mechanism of Finding’s inside a Rule. Additionally it handles suppression and aliases management.interface Context
    CorrectableCodeSmell Represents a code smell for that can be auto corrected.open class CorrectableCodeSmell : CodeSmell
    Debt Debt describes the estimated amount of work needed to fix a given issue.data class Debt
    DefaultContext Default Context implementation.open class DefaultContext : Context
    Detektion Storage for all kinds of findings and additional information which needs to be transferred from the detekt engine to the user.interface Detektion
    DetektVisitor Basic visitor which is used inside detekt. Guarantees a better looking name as the extended base class :).open class DetektVisitor : KtTreeVisitorVoid
    Entity Stores information about a specific code fragment.data class Entity : Compactable
    Extension Defines extension points in detekt. Currently supported extensions are:interface Extension
    FileProcessListener Gather additional metrics about the analyzed kotlin file. Pay attention to the thread policy of each function!interface FileProcessListener : Extension
    Finding Base interface of detection findings. Inherits a bunch of useful behaviour from sub interfaces.interface Finding : Compactable, HasEntity, HasMetrics
    HasEntity Describes a source code position.interface HasEntity
    HasMetrics Adds metric container behaviour.interface HasMetrics
    HierarchicalConfig A configuration which keeps track of the config it got sub-config’ed from by the subConfig function. It’s main usage is to recreate the property-path which was taken when using the subConfig function repeatedly.interface ~~HierarchicalConfig~~ : Config
    Issue An issue represents a problem in the codebase.data class Issue
    LazyRegex LazyRegex class provides a lazy evaluation of a Regex pattern for usages inside Rules. It computes the value once when reaching the point of its usage and returns the same value when requested again.class LazyRegex : ReadOnlyProperty<Rule, Regex>
    Location Specifies a position within a source code fragment.data class Location : Compactable
    Metric Metric type, can be an integer or double value. Internally it is stored as an integer, but the conversion factor and is double attributes can be used to retrieve it as a double value.data class Metric
    MultiRule Composite rule which delegates work to child rules. Can be used to combine different rules which do similar work like scanning the source code line by line to increase performance.abstract class MultiRule : BaseRule
    Notification Any kind of notification which should be printed to the console. For example when using the formatting rule set, any change to your kotlin file is a notification.interface Notification
    OutputReport Translates detekt’s result container - Detektion - into an output report which is written inside a file.abstract class OutputReport : Extension
    ProjectMetric Anything that can be expressed as a number value for projects.open class ProjectMetric
    Rule A rule defines how one specific code structure should look like. If code is found which does not meet this structure, it is considered as harmful regarding maintainability or readability.abstract class Rule : BaseRule, ConfigAware
    RuleId The type to use when referring to rule ids giving it more context then a String would.typealias RuleId = String
    RuleSet A rule set is a collection of rules and must be defined within a rule set provider implementation.class RuleSet
    RuleSetId typealias RuleSetId = String
    RuleSetProvider A rule set provider, as the name states, is responsible for creating rule sets.interface RuleSetProvider
    SetupContext Context providing useful processing settings to initialize extensions.interface SetupContext
    Severity Rules can classified into different severity grades. Maintainer can choose a grade which is most harmful to their projects.enum class Severity
    SingleAssign Allows to assign a property just once. Further assignments result in IllegalStateException’s.class SingleAssign<T : Any>
    SourceLocation Stores line and column information of a location.data class SourceLocation
    SplitPattern Splits given text into parts and provides testing utilities for its elements. Basic use cases are to specify different function or class names in the detekt yaml config and test for their appearance in specific rules.open class SplitPattern
    TextLocation Stores character start and end positions of an text file.data class TextLocation
    ThresholdedCodeSmell Represents a code smell for which a specific metric can be determined which is responsible for the existence of this rule violation.open class ThresholdedCodeSmell : CodeSmell
    ThresholdRule Provides a threshold attribute for this rule, which is specified manually for default values but can be also obtained from within a configuration object.abstract class ThresholdRule : Rule
    YamlConfig Config implementation using the yaml format. SubConfigurations can return sub maps according to the yaml specification.typealias ~~YamlConfig~~ = YamlConfig

    Annotations

    UnstableApi Experimental detekt api which may change on minor or patch versions.annotation class UnstableApi

    Extensions for External Classes

    kotlin.String  
    org.jetbrains.kotlin.psi.KtAnnotated  
    org.jetbrains.kotlin.psi.KtElement  

    Properties

    DEFAULT_FLOAT_CONVERSION_FACTOR To represent a value of 0.5, use the metric value 50 and the conversion factor of 100. (50 / 100 = 0.5)const val DEFAULT_FLOAT_CONVERSION_FACTOR: Int
